description: For sale is one of the most collectible American cars ever produced. This rare car is one of the few Skyliners produced with factory air conditioning in 1957. The Skyliner, also referred to as a Retractable or Hide-away Hardtop, was produced for only three years, 1957 through 1959. The 1957 is considered to be the most collectible Production was started on April 14, 1957 and 20,766 were produced in the first year. This car was built on April 18, the 5th day of production, in the Louisville, Kentucky plant. The roof quarter trim Skyliner emblems were not available for the first few production cars and consequently this car was produced without them making it very rare. This car is an older frame off restoration of a rust free car showing 96,031 miles.
title: 1957 Ford Fairlane

description: Rotisserie restored. Let's start underneath. Powder coated frame, rear end and chassis components. Stainless lines, new gas tank, completely rebuilt suspension. Wilwood 4 wheel disc brake conversion. Heavy sway bars. Really sharp 18 inch wheels with performance BFG tires. Custom 2 1/2 inch exhaust. Floors are sprayed with sound deadener. Car is lowered. Clean, straight body has show quality paint. Gorgeous colors. Every piece of exterior chrome is replated including bumpers, grill, headlight bezels, door handles, windshield trim, emblems, side moldings. All new weatherstrips, window fuzzies, windshield and gasket. Custom upholstery and trunk done to match. Motor rebuilt 11-1-16 at a cost of $5,950, trans and rear end are rebuilt. Motor compartment is detailed, firewall is painted. There is a fortune spent on this car. Has a unique look that everyone seems to enjoy.
Power steering
Power 4 wheel disc
18 wheels
Grant wheel
Trans cooler
title: 1962 Ford Galaxie 500

description: Built December 26, 1968 at Ford's Dearborn facility, and sold new at DaveSyverson Ford in Minnesota, the car offered here is finished in its originalcolor combination of Acapulco Blue with a black Clarion knit comfort weaveinterior. This concours quality Super Cobra Jet Mach 1 is documented thru MartiAuto Works and includes the original factory invoice and window sticker. Factoryoptions ordered with this car include 428R Super Cobra Jet engine, four speedclose ratio toploader transmission, 3.91:1 axle ratio with Drag Pack option, F70x 14 Goodyear raised white letter tires, power disc brakes,   AM radio and tinted glass. Restoration of this low mileage car wasdone in 2001 with every component, from tires to glass is original, restored, orcorrect replacement as per Mustang Club of America's specifications and hasbeen shown in MCA's Concours Trailered Driven category. This Mach 1reflects a livetime of proper maintenance and care and can be driven or shownwith equal confidence in its abilities. This is a rare opportunity to own one ofthe most collectible Mustangs ever produced from the most desirable year.
title: 1969 Ford Mustang

description: Worldwide Vintage Autos is pleased to present this 1965 Ford Mustang. We scour the country for vintage cars and trucks and we rarely come across one like this! You must see and drive this rare Mustang!  HISTORY  The Ford Mustang was brought out five months before the normal start of the 1965 production year. The early production versions are often referred to as "1964Â½ models" but all Mustangs were advertised, VIN coded and titled by Ford as 1965 models, though minor design updates for fall 1965 contribute to tracking 1964Â½ production data separately from 1965 data (see data below). with production beginning in Dearborn, Michigan on March 9, 1964; the new car was introduced to the public on April 17, 1964 at the New York World's Fair. SOURCE:  WIKIPEDIA   SPECIFICS / BUILD INFORMATION  EXTERIOR   -Repainted and laser straight!  -Turbo-Tech G/T Radial 205/70R14 front and 245/60R14 rear tires.   -Cragar SS Mag wheels.  -GT 350 side scoop and hood scoop.  INTERIOR  -New interior.  -Bucket seats.  -GLOVE BOX COVER HAS BEEN SIGNED BY CAROL SHELBY!     MECHANICAL  -Rebuilt 289 V8 Quick!  -C4 Automatic transmission.  -Dual exhaust.  -Air Conditioning!   DISCLOSURE  -There are a few chips / imperfections in the paint. (See detailed pictures)  -Small tear in seat and evidence of weather on wheels. (See detailed pictures)    Own this vintage 1965 Ford Mustang at wholesale cost. The cost of parts and restoration of these vehicles are increasing daily. Buy one complete and ensure your investment for the future.  Don't do the work yourself, get one finished for roughly half of the cost of building it yourself!   An excellent investment and something you can enjoy daily. Collectible vintage vehicles have historically appreciated at a rate greater than that stock market, gold and other arts and collectibles as documented by many articles and auction result tracking.     NEED MORE DETAILED INFORMATION? CALL US AND WE WILL HELP ANY WAY POSSIBLE!   1-877-422-2940  WORLDWIDE VINTAGE AUTOS [. C O M ]     FINANCING:  JJ BEST BANC. COLLECTOR CAR FINANCING  800-872-1965  Please mention you are working with Worldwide Vintage Autos in order to expedite the process.  DEPOSITS:  Deposits to hold vehicles is $500. Upon payment of the $500 deposit, the vehicle will be held for 7 days pending final payment. Deposits are non-refundable due to i). the vehicles are taken off the market and we turn down other buyers during the 7 day period and ii). there is significant re-marketing costs associated with relisting / remarketing our vehicles. Inspections should be performed prior to putting a deposit down on a vehicle.   INSPECTIONS:  We encourage inspections. We disclose known defects and imperfections but we are not you. Purchasing a vehicle is very subjective. Come visit our showroom in Denver, CO, we would love to meet you in person!  SHIPPING:  We recommend having our shipping coordinator facilitate the transport of your new vehicle.  We can handle all shipping arrangements
title: 1965 Ford Mustang

description: This 1969 Boss was built in the first week of production (half year model). Themileage is original and so is the paint. It looks stock, but every major systemhas been performance upgraded. The engine is a real deal Boss 302 (Replacement71 Boss Block) and all OEM 69 Parts, heads crank, rods, intake manifold, CrowerSolid Cam. Hi-Volume Oil Pump 10 Qt Road Race Oil Pan, etc. and factory 4bblHolley 780 cfm carb with Ford part no, MSD Ignition System. Delco Alternator.Every part inside this engine has been upgraded and blueprinted. Trans is a DougNash 5-spd with a Hydraulic Clutch. Fuel delivery system has been enhanced (like fuel injection). All Global West suspension, front to back with sub frameconnectors. Koni Shocks. Setup as a Trans-Am Stage 2 spec car and a 1980 LincolnVersailles rear end housing with original Nodular case and rear disc brakes.Battery is in trunk (stainless case). Have factory Magnum 500 15" Wheels.Correct 8-Track Player. Have original Build Sheet, (Found Under Carpet). Car wasrun at club events, in the 90's, at Portland International Raceway,therefore it was modified for that purpose when required. So have the followingitems for that purpose, Wheels and race tires, Hood, Custom Air Cleaner, Rollbar, and Racing Seats with Racing Harness, all these parts are bolt on and arenot needed for street use. Would be great for Historic Racing.

title: 1955 Ford Thunderbird

description: This auction is for a beautiful 1935 Ford Deluxe Rumble seat Roadster. It is allHenry Ford steel . A good friend of mine has owned this for many years now. Hekeeps it in a heated garage and just uses it on special occasions . The time hascome where he is going to down size and possible move to a smaller property. Sothe Roadster is going up for sale. When he purchased the car it was in goodrestorable condition but needed to be done. He had correct floor pans installed,along with lower front cowl panels, and lower quarter panel sections. The restis original. All panels were butt welded no over lapping or anything like that.This was done by a professional restorer of vintage cars at a two year timeframe. The underneath of the car is all original clean and solid. The paintcolor is Washington blue but does look black in certain light. The interior wasprofessionally restored also . Top bows and irons were restored. He does havethe side curtains and irons also. The motor is a 37 block which has full insertswith 37 heads. Has a 934 rear end which figures out roughly to a 373 gear ratio.Excellent for cruising. Brakes have been upgraded to juice brakes for betterstopping power. All the chrome and trim are in very nice condition. Some hasbeen redone and some original. All gauges in the dash work including fuel gauge,fog lights work. No over heating issues of any type. You could drive this carhome if you wanted too. He hates to part with the car but the time has come.Youdon't see these come up for sale very often. If ever you wanted a nice 35Roadster here is your chance. It will only be offered this one time only .

description: 1963 1/2 Ford Falcon Sprint 4 Speed. Car is restored and always covered in garage unless showing or cruising around town. New factory tach installed on dash that was $600 itself. Engine is 302 out of Mustang GT bored 30 over w/ 10:1 compression pistons, roller rockers, Victor Jr. intake w/ Ford Motorsports X cam, Sanderson headers w/ Flow-master dual exhaust routed out rear,8 rear end w/ 350 gears. Engine only has approx. 100 miles on it since restored.

description: This one is a real head-turner, burnt orange with a gray two tone & blackout,very little chrome. Powered by a 454 Chevy crate motor with a 400 - 3 on thetree speed power-glide trans with a 2200rpm stall converter. With PS, PB, DOTLED headlights, electric fan and water pump and a 300 watt Bluetooth stereosystem, no radio head cut into dash. You drive in comfort kept cool by a vintageair AC system and relax in the custom high back seats with flip up consolecenter seat. I drive this truck at least 3 days a week, and love the truck, butmoving on to retire on the water and to put her in storage for years is theworst thing I could do. I get complements every time I start the truck. Therewas over $40,000 spent on just parts, paint and interior, no labor included. Ihave most of the receipts in a file and the motor has had the oil changed every3k miles...
title: 1961 Ford F-100
